[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: pc] [PC Jump Validation] Is the PC validated against the actual bytecode length of the function, or can invalid jumps cause execution of data as code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: pc] [PC Initialization] The PC is initialized to 0 (line 224). Can malicious modules have invalid bytecode at offset 0 that gets executed before validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: locals] [Local Variable Type Mismatch] Can there be a mismatch between the types in local_tys and the actual values in locals, allowing type confusion attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: locals] [Uninitialized Local Access] Can an attacker access local variables before they are initialized, reading sensitive data from previous stack frames? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: locals] [Local Variable Aliasing] Can multiple frames share references to the same Locals structure, causing unintended aliasing and data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: _guard] [Profiling Side Channel] Can FnGuard profiling information leak execution timing or patterns that could be used for side-channel attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Field: _guard] [Guard Drop Timing] When _guard is None during runtime type checks, does this create observable timing differences that could be exploited? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Error Handling] [Partial VM Error Conversion] Throughout the file, functions return PartialVMResult. Can error conversion lose critical security information about what failed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Error Handling] [Error Recovery] When functions return errors, is the Frame state left in a consistent state, or can partial updates leave it in a corrupted state that affects subsequent operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Error Handling] [Panic Safety] Can any of the unreachable!() macros be triggered through bytecode manipulation, causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: LoadedFunctionOwner matching] [Owner Type Confusion] Can the LoadedFunctionOwner enum be corrupted to make a Module appear as a Script or vice versa, bypassing access restrictions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: LoadedFunctionOwner matching] [Script Type Instructions] Multiple functions have unreachable!() for Script owners accessing type instructions (lines 292, 304, 316, 326, 345, 357, 383, 393, 402, 413, 426, 500, 509, 518, 527, 539, 557). Can malicious bytecode in scripts trigger these panics to DoS validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: create_ty_with_subst] [Substitution Depth] Can deeply nested type substitutions in create_ty_with_subst() cause stack overflow or excessive memory consumption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: create_ty_with_subst] [Substitution Circular Reference] Can circular type references in substitutions cause infinite loops during type creation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: function.ty_args()] [Type Arguments Access] Can function.ty_args() return stale or incorrect type arguments if the function's type context changes during execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Pattern: function.ty_args()] [Type Arguments Mutation] Can the type arguments be mutated after the frame is created, causing type confusion in operations that cache the type arguments? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Gas Metering] [Type Node Counting] Can num_nodes() or num_nodes_in_subst() miscalculate the number of type nodes for complex types, undercharging gas? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Gas Metering] [Create Type Charges] Are charge_create_ty() calls atomic with type creation, or can a failure between gas charging and type creation cause inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Gas Metering] [Cached Type Gas] When types are cached, is gas charged on every use or only on first creation, and can this be exploited for gas savings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Gas Metering] [NumTypeNodes Conversion] Can the u64 conversion in NumTypeNodes::new() overflow or lose precision for extremely complex types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Index Types] [Index Type Confusion] Can FieldHandleIndex, FieldInstantiationIndex, StructDefinitionIndex, etc. be confused with each other if they all use u16 internally? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/frame.rs] [Index Types] [Index Casting] When indices are cast with 'idx.0 as usize', can this cause issues on platforms where usize is smaller than expected? (Low)
